intro: Gossypium vollesenii, commonly known as the Vollesen's cotton, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces fluffy, white fibers that are similar to those of other cotton species, though it is less commercially cultivated. Gossypium vollesenii typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, temperate climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
